p: Facing unprecedented socioecological breakdown, the time is ripe for Europe to re-examine its epistemologies (knowledge systems) and ontologies (philosophies of life) concerning human relations with the wider ecology. Indigenous cosmologies or philosophies of life are known for positioning all forms of life—animals, plants, trees, bacteria, viruses—as part of one whole biosphere or ecology (Gebara 2021; Gram-Hanssen et al. 2021). Beyond indigenous cosmologies, modern and western science and scholars also increasingly question the human–nature duality, stressing the importance of epistemic plurality (Biermann 2020; Pascual et al. 2021).
